723113f-a.text:
St. Mark's Place, south side, east from, but not including Second Ave., to, but not including First Ave. Shown is St. Cyril's R.C. Church at No. 62.

October 28, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.
723113f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & 1st Avenue, Manhattan, NY

723109f-a.text:
72 to 78 St. Mark's Place, (East 8th Street), south side, between Second and First Aves., showing (No. 74) The Stuyvesant Neighborhood House, Clara Buttenwieser Unger Memorial. No. 72 (extreme right), has been joined to No. 74 and remodeled to constitute a single 4-story unit, now (1937) bearing the Nos. 72-74.

July 24, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
723109f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & 1st Avenue, Manhattan, NY

723112f-a.text:
St. Marks Place (East 8th Street) north side, east from but not including Second to First Aves. Note the elevated station of the Second Ave. Line on First Ave.

December 7, 1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
723112f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & 1st Avenue, Manhattan, NY

723110f-a.text:
82 and 80 St. Marks Place, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of First Ave. (left, elevated line thereon), showing the side wall of the corner structure (No. 82, also No. 131 First Ave.) being supported against collapse. This thoroughfare is actually a portion of East 8th Street.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr .
723110f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & 1st Avenue, Manhattan, NY

St. Mark's Place, (East 8th Street), north side, west from, but not including First, to, but not including Second Aves. Shown is the Odd Fellows Temple at No. 69.

October 28, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
